posts.post_title: Very tough t207 Morris Rath SGC 40 (Anonymous back) for trade/sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Brian McQueen
Not a player that's easily found in the t207 set at all.  The Rath actually makes for a very presentable card.  No creasing and no damage on the back.  No other surface nicks or wear exists on the card either.  Plus, the Anonymous back is one of the tougher t207 backs out there.  

I'd prefer to trade and have my wantlist included below.  I'd also be willing to sell the card for $225 for those wishing to go that route.  Thanks in advance,

Brian
redmaccie@hotmail.com


c46 - Adkins
t207 Napoleon backs - need most
t210 Orange Borders - need most
w590 - Ruth, Spencer, Johnson
1919 Zeenuts - Lane (oak), Nourse (oak), Pinelli (sac), Prough (sac), Vance (sac), Spencer (saltlake), Seaton (SF), Smith (SF), Snell (SF), Eastley (SEA), Arbuckle (Vern), Check (Vern), Houck (Vern), Meusel (vern)
1918 Zeenuts - any
v117 Maple Crispettes - Barnes, Dolan, Bassler, Meusel, Peckinpaugh & Jacobson
d311 - Agnew, Arrelanes, Berry, Brashear, Burrell, Byram, Castleton, Chadbourne, Christian, Daley, Danzig, Delhi, Dillon, Fitzgerald, Gipe, Gregory, Harkness, Heister, Holland, Howard, Kuhn, LaLonge, Lewis, Maggert, Meikle, Mitze, Mohler, Moore, Murray, O’Rourke, Patterson, Pearce, Rapps, Ryan, Schmidt, Stamfield, Steen, Sutor, Tennant, Thompson, Van Buren, Wares
t205 Broadleaf backs - need all
